citations.narrative:
The Contingency Plan available for review at the time of the inspection was incomplete. The Licensee used APHIS Form
7093 (USDA/APHIS/Animal Care Contingency Planning Program) to document the Contingency Plan, but the sections of
the form were blank where provide the details of the Plan for the situations that trigger implementation of the Plan, the
specific tasks/responsible person(s) for the tasks, and the specific resources needed to perform the tasks.
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling,
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster (one which could
reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the animals in their
possession) and should have been in place by 7/5/22. The contingency plan requirement ensures that the animals receive
proper care during emergency situations.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.
*END OF REPORT*
